titles.title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate a section of the Columbia River in Washington State as a study area for inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. Report No: 100-960.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1041.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

vote.text: House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 10/12/1988--Passed Senate amended. (Measure passed Senate, amended) Requires the Secretary of the Interior to prepare a comprehensive river conservation study for a specified segment (study area) of the Columbia River, Washington. Requires the study to identify and evaluate the outstanding features of the study area and its environment, including fish and wildlife, geologic, scenic, recreational, natural, historical, and cultural values, and examine alternatives for their preservation. Requires the Secretary to consult with State, local, and tribal governments with respect to the study and to provide for public comment. Prohibits any Federal agency, for a period of eight years after enactment of this Act, from constructing any dam, channel, or navigation project within the study area. Sets forth other requirements with respect to such study area. Authorizes appropriations.
